column4: I have not tried configuring vid card yet because I am not sure what to do from here ;(
I do not have Xorg.Conf only Xorg.Conf.bak
my only choices for resolution are 600X800??

your video drivers are not installed properly or something.  I have the same problem.  You need to manually add the resolution using 'xrandr' and then manually set the resolution.  The link I gave y9ou teaches you how to do that, or you can just download teh script file in that post if you want THAT specific resolution.
are you following the instructions in the link I gave you
I gave you a link to fix your problem.  Are you following those instructions or not?  If not, you shoudl be.

what are you talking about?  Listen, I gave you a link to fix yoru problem.  Either you will follow the instructions and recieve help or you can try to play the guessing game with random people in here. http://chvnx.com/post/280205781/change-screen-resolution-in-linux-ubuntu  -- do what this website says and your problem will be fixed.  Or don't.
ignore repo_man he is trolling (ie: starting trouble for fun)
I get errors when I run the script and follow the instruction from the web site?

well, you cont do both run teh script AND follow the instructions.  If the script does not work then use the instructions to write yoru own.  Dont just copy every line of the code on the page, use the data to write your own by following the instructions.
http://chvnx.com/post/280205781/change-screen-resolution-in-linux-ubuntu  follow these instructions and change it according to your desired resolution.  Replace VGA1 with VGA.
